USA: The Massachusetts Bay Colony was founded.
Taiwan: Madou ambushes and kills 35 Dutch soldiers
Poland: Signing of the Truce of Altmark
Latvia: The Peace of Altmark was reached, under which Sweden annexed Livonia and several Courland territories to Swedish Livonia.
Indonesia: Iskandar Muda of Aceh Sultanate launched a failed attempt to take Portuguese Malacca.
Germany: Holy Roman Emperor Ferdinand II issued the Edict of Restitution, which demanded that lands expropriated since and in contradiction to the terms of the Peace of Augsburg be restored to the Catholic Church.
Colombia: Foundation of Barranca de San Nicolas (Later Barranquilla ) by Galapa indigenous people
Belgium: Siege of 's-Hertogenbosch: one of the four chief cities of the Duchy of Brabant falls to the Dutch Republic.
Barbados: Forces of Carlisle's employ arrived in Barbados and arrested Courten's governor.

The colony became divided into six original parishes. A vestry framework for local government is devised, and parishes are administered by elected landowners who had the powers to tax and carry out basic municipal functions, such as road maintenance.
Australia: VOC ship Batavia wrecked on Houtman Abrolhos, off Geraldton. Mutiny ensued and at least 110 men, women and children were murdered. First European structure in Australia - Wiebbe Hayes Stone Fort on West Wallabi Island.
